recursive subroutine my_sort( a )

implicit none

integer, intent(inout) :: a(:)

integer :: i, j, n, temp

n= size(a)

do i=1,n-1

   do j=1, n-i

      if (a(j) > a(j+1)) then

         temp = a(j)

         a(j) = a(j+1) 

         a(j+1) = temp 

      end if 

   end do 

end do

recursive subroutine my_sort( a )

implicit none

integer, intent(inout) :: a(:)

integer :: i, j, n, temp

n= size(a)

do i=1,n-1

   do j=1, n-i

      if (a(j) > a(j+1)) then

         temp = a(j)

         a(j) = a(j+1) 

         a(j+1) = temp 

      end if 

   end do 

end do 

end subroutine

 !----- Subroutines here  
 subroutine my_sort(arr)  
  integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)  
  integer :: i,j, temp  
  integer :: n = size(arr)  
  ! 小到大 bubble sort.  
  do i=1, n-1  
   do j=1, n -i  
    if( arr(j) > arr(j+1) ) then  
     temp = arr(j)  
     arr(j) = arr(j+1)  
     arr(j+1) = temp  
    end if  
   end do  
  end do  
 end subroutine my_sort  

 subroutine func(a_in, new_a, has_one)  
        implicit none  
        integer, intent(in) :: a_in(:)  
        integer, allocatable, intent(out) :: new_a(:)  
        logical, intent(out) :: has_one  

        integer :: i, count_non_zero, tmp(size(a_in))  
        integer :: min_val, new_val, count  
        integer, allocatable :: new_elements(:)  

        ! Count non-zero elements in a_in  
        count_non_zero = 0  
        do i =1, size(a_in)  
            if ( a_in(i) /=0 ) then  
                count_non_zero = count_non_zero +1  
            end if  
        end do  

        ! Create tmp array with non-zero elements  
        allocate( tmp(count_non_zero) )  
        count =0  
        do i =1, size(a_in)  
            if ( a_in(i) /=0 ) then  
                count = count +1  
                tmp(count) = a_in(i)  
            end if  
        end do  

        min_val = tmp(1)  
        has_one = .false.  

        allocate(new_elements(count_non_zero))  
        new_elements(1) = min_val  

        do i=2, count_non_zero  
            new_val = mod(tmp(i), min_val)  
            new_elements(i) = new_val  

            if ( new_val == 1 ) then  
                has_one = .true.  
            end if  
        end do  

        ! Sort new_elements  
        call my_sort(new_elements)  

        ! Store the sorted array into new_a  
        allocate( new_a(size(new_elements)) )  
        new_a = new_elements  

        deallocate(new_elements)  

 return  
 end subroutine func  
 !--- end of contains  
 end program

 这段代码 还存在一个错误。 因为数组分配的重新赋值需要确保 a has a suitable dimension.

 在Fortran中， 如果 a is allocated, and you assign a = new_a则，只复制了元素，但 only when the array has compatible shapes. So, perhaps the correct practice is:

首先 deallocate the previous a:

 deallocate(a)

然后 allocate a with the new size, but 与 new_a有相同的size:

 allocate(a(size(new_a))) 

然后 assign a = new_a 

 或者, 更简单 ways 是:

a = new_a 在 fortran中将触发 an automatic allocation 每当的右端的新 array has a different size.

 在Fortran 2003以后的标准中， 可以使用allocatable arrays的 assignment:

如果 a is allocatable并 has the same type, then a = new_a wield recycles the allocation and resizes it accordingly.

 所以在 Fortran 2003兼容实现中， simply `a = new_a` will handle the allocation.

 因此, 在 main loop， the codes should have:

在 loop:

    a = new_a

！ Since new_a isرباعnow assigned to a， thus new_a’s memory may still be allocated and need to be dealelocated to avoid memory leak。 

所以 the loop should have:

    a = new_a 

    deallocate( new_a ) 

这样可以确保每次循环中 new_a's memory is freed.
